direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 3)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In one step, the existing element enlarges and a new element appears inside this element. In the next step, the outer element is lost.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 3)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The shading moves in the sequence as shown in the figure:The similar upper element appears in every fourth step. The lower element is replaced by a new element in every second step.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 3)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In one step, the figure gets laterally inverted and one line segment is lost from the upper end of the RHS portion of the figure. In the next step, the figure gets laterally inverted and one line segment is lost from the upper end of the LHS portion of the figure.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Two, three, four, two, three,..... curves get inverted sequentially.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each step, all the elements move to the adjacent corner (of the square boundary) in an ACW direction. Also, the elements that reach the lower-right and upper-left positions get vertically inverted alternately.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The shading moves upwards sequentially from lower-left corner to the upper-right corner of the rhombus and once it reaches the upper-right corner, it moves to the lower-left corner in the next step. Also, in each step, all the symbols move to the adjacent side (of the rhombus) in a CW direction and the symbol that reaches the LHS position gets replaced by a new symbol.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 4 - 7)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In one step, a black circle is added to the figure at the CW-end of the existing circles and a line segment is added on the upper side. In the next step, a white circle is added to the figure at the ACW-end of the existing circles and a line segment is added on the lower side.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The rightmost element enlarges to become the outer element; the leftmost element becomes the inner-lower element and the middle element becomes the inner-upper element.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 8 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The figure gets laterally inverted.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 10 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The figure rotates 90oCW; gets reduced in size and also gets enclosed in a figure with one less number of sides.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 10 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The figure is rotated through 180oand a new line segment is added to the figure obtained.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 10 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The elements move in the sequenceThe element reaching the lower-right position rotates 45oCW; the element reaching the upper-right position rotates 90oACW; the element reaching the upper-left position rotates 135oCW and the element reaching the lower-left position rotates through 180o.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 10 - 13)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. answer_description: The figure gets laterally inverted and all the arcs get curved in the opposite direction.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 18)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Each one of the figures, except fig. (4), is formed by three line segments.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 18)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Only in fig. (3), the line segment is not a diameter of the circle.

answer_description: All other are vowels.

question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)

question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: Only in fig. (4), all the leaves have their outer halves shaded.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 19 - 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
